## Remarks
By default, the JSON is written without any indentation or extra white space. Also, <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter> throws an exception if the user attempts to write structurally invalid JSON.

Docs.value: to skip structural validation and allow invalid JSON; to throw an on any attempt to write invalid JSON.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the JSON being written is known to be correct, then skipping validation (by setting this property to `true`) could improve performance. An example of invalid JSON where the writer will throw (when `SkipValidation` is set to `false`) is when you write a value within a JSON object without a property name.
